ai-thi-ap12:1.1_0: “One from the bank of the river,
ai-thi-ap12:1.2_0: I was one who spoke about
ai-thi-ap12:3.1_0: Having received it from the Sambuddha, the Awakened One,
ai-thi-ap12:3.4_0: Thinking: “My loven, has been good for me,
ai-thi-ap12:4.1_0: raising his hands in respectful salutation,
ai-thi-ap12:4.2_0: I paid homage to the supreme Buddha.
ai-thi-ap12:4.4_0: Then to the mountain named Mount Vepulla,
ai-thi-ap12:5.2_0: Then the flower-meater (work) from that gift,
ai-thi-ap12:5.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-thi-ap12:7.1_0: It was so welcome for me
ai-thi-ap12:9.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the nun Sāḷalī.
